title: 111_s2901
content:
The "Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009" establishes the Government-Wide Acquisition Management Fellows Program under the Office of Federal Procurement Policy Act. The Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009 establishes a government-wide acquisition management fellows program to invest in the long-term improvement of the Federal acquisition workforce. The program aims to develop new acquisition leaders with government-wide perspective, recruit individuals with outstanding academic merit and leadership skills, and offer advancement opportunities and competitive compensation upon completion. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program aims to develop new leaders with academic merit and leadership skills for the Federal Government. The program includes contracts with qualified universities, one year of on-campus training followed by two years of on-the-job training, and a curriculum focused on Federal Government acquisition. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program involves one year of on-campus training followed by two years of on-the-job training towards a Masters degree. The curriculum includes rotational assignments at executive agencies and non-agency-specific training courses for basic contracting officer warrant. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program includes training in contracts, terminations, contract close-out, non-agency-specific training courses, transparency, accountability, integrity in public contracting, and other necessary education. Graduates receive priority for employment in executive agencies based on performance and qualifications. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program prioritizes graduates for hiring in the acquisition field at GS-12, 13, or 14 levels. A maximum of 200 individuals can enter the program each year, with at least 50 participants required. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program limits annual participants to 200 individuals, with a minimum of 50 in the first year, 100 in the second year, and 150 thereafter. The Administrator is responsible for program management, participant selection, and placement upon graduation. Qualified universities with expertise in Federal Government acquisition can enter into contracts for program administration. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program is overseen by the Administrator, who manages the program, selects participants, and ensures their placement upon graduation. Participating universities can choose and remove program participants according to academic processes. Career development of participants is periodically reviewed post-placement to adjust the program as needed. Selected individuals commit to federal employment in acquisition after completing the program. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program requires participants to commit to federal employment in acquisition for a minimum term of one year for each year in the program. Candidates who do not fulfill the program requirements must reimburse the government for funds received. A fund called the OFPP Acquisition Fellows Program Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States. The OFPP Acquisition Fellows Development Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States to cover expenses for the program, including tuition, books, materials, room, and board for students. The OFPP Acquisition Fellows Development Fund covers expenses for the program, including tuition, books, materials, room, board, travel, stipends, planning, administration, and other necessary expenses as determined by the Administrator. The Fund is funded by appropriations or other available sources. The Administrator will submit reports on the government-wide acquisition management fellows program, including a preliminary report within 120 days of enactment and annual reports thereafter to the appropriate congressional committees. The reports will detail the program activities and budget requirements. The Administrator will submit annual reports to congressional committees on the government-wide acquisition management fellows program. The reports will include a description of program activities, effectiveness assessment, and recommendations for legislative or administrative action. The Administrator will submit annual reports to congressional committees on the government-wide acquisition management fellows program, including program activities, effectiveness assessment, and recommendations for legislative or administrative action. Appropriations for the OFPP Acquisition Fellows Development Fund are authorized for fiscal years 2011 and 2012. Authorization of Appropriations for the OFPP Acquisition Fellows Development Fund:
- $16,000,000 for fiscal year 2011
- $32,000,000 for fiscal year 2012
- $48,000,000 for fiscal year 2013.
